Jake worked at Northern Arizona University before you started
Create, record, and promote Adobe product courses for online consumption at Pluralsight.com

Same freelance business re-established in Colorado. Graphic & Media Design, Illustration, and Web production and consultation for small and large businesses across the United States. Specialty: Logos and BrandingIllustrations: Medical and otherPackaging: cartons, labels, Instructions for Use - English and Multi-Lingual layoutsWeb, eblast and micro-website design and developmentMultimedia presentations with Video, PPT, PDF, Prezi, Flash, layout and interactive design

Primarily print, photography, illustration, and print, but some multimedia, video, and web projects for wide assortment of clients: small businesses, government agencies and large, Fortune 500 companies.

Assisted professors to migrate current "live" courses to online courses. Process included: meeting with professors, liaison between department's technical, creative, and educational support team members, as well as other university departments, providing timelines for strict deadlines for completion, other design and technical assistance and training.

Wore many hats in this postion. Led all print, video, web, multimedia, marketing, and product ordering/processing database operations for self-sustaining, non-profit organization housed at Northern Arizona University. Assisted with the development, production, and distribution for sale Elementary Spanish for Grades 1-6, educación española, and Beginning Tai Chi with Patrick Martin, all of which are still broadcast on the Universityhouse Channel on the DISH Network satellite broadcast system.
Worked as a custodian for an elementary school and at a privately-owned video rental store. Society of The Employed and Educated. (I just made that up).

recommendations: Julie Bergman
Owner: Coyote House Design, LLC
March 16, 2016, Julie reported directly to Jake

Jake is a rare find. A gifted designer, innovator and businessman, Jake excels at organizing a project from the start and mapping out a clear path to the finish line. He constantly pushes his own creativity to discover new solutions to the problem at hand. Having worked with Jake for over 15 years, both as his employee and as his peer, I can unequivocally recommend him for any endeavor…Jake makes the work fun.
Julie Bergman

Videographer/Producer, Multimedia and Marketing Specialist at Northern Arizona University
March 16, 2016, Margo worked with Jake in the same group

Margo was a great co-worker both creatively and personally when we first began working at Educational Systems Programming at NAU. I was lucky enough to also work with her at W. L. Gore & Associates, Inc., and then again, more closely, at NAU with EMIL. Where I lacked technical knowledge for various multimedia projects, she filled in the gaps. Her hard work and dedication to projects made her a great asset at each of these different and unique places of employment.

No matter the task at hand, Julie always engaged herself whole-heartedly and with an eagerness and vigor I wish all could possess. She was then, and still is my first "go-to" person when an additional design or technical help is needed. It is for these reasons that she was hired after completing her student internship with our group. It is also why I have since contracted her services ever since.

summary: Balance, organization, honesty, and attentiveness are my cornerstones to life, whether it be developing a logo for a small business, creating a series of medical illustrations for a large corporation, or involvement with my family's weekly schedule.I studied and graduated in Visual Communication. Love, life, and death have guided my journey of corporate, educational, and freelance design and creative work for nearly 20 years.I create art with an objective. I have amassed a large collection of tools and skills to approach each challenge.
